required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of SARS-CoV-2 Antibodies Among Healthcare Workers in a COVID-19 Unit

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitario Dr. Jose E. Gonzalez

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitario Dr. Jose E. Gonzalez

brief_summary.textblock: Observational, point of prevalence study determining the presence of anti-SARS-CoV-2 antibody

detailed_description.textblock: All Healthcare workers (HCW) who had entered contaminated areas at least once and that 14 days or more had passed from their first entrance to contaminated areas were included. They were classified as asymptomatic and pauci-symptomatic. A COVID-19 IgG/IgM rapid test was used for antibody detection, and selected participants were subject to real time polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) for SARS-CoV-2.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: presence of IgG and/or IgM against SARS-CoV-2

arm_group.description: Healthcare workers working for 8 weeks in a COVID-19 area

intervention.intervention_name: COVID-19 IgG/IgM Rapid Test Cassette test (Healgen Scientific, Houston, Texas, USA)
intervention.description: a blood sample is drained for detection of IgG and IgM antibody

study_pop.textblock: Healthcare workes of any category that are 18 years of age or older, who work in the COVID-19 unit at the University Hospital and hve been diagnosing and treating suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All healthcare workers who had entered contaminated areas at least once and that 14 days or more had passed from their first entrance were included
Exclusion Criteria:
- Healthcare workers who did not have exposure for more or equal 14 days
- Healthcare workers who did not wish to participate

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Hospital Universitario Dr. Jose E. Gonzalez
